title: Joshua 17:5
content: 5 And ten measured portions of Manasseh fell, apart from the land of the Gilead and the Bashan, which were from the other side of the Jordan.

title: Joshua 17:6
content: 6 For the daughters of Manasseh inherited an inheritance in the midst of his sons. And the land of the Gilead was for the remaining sons of Manasseh.

title: Joshua 17:7
content: 7 And the border of Manasseh was from Asher to the Mikmethath, which is on the face of Shechem. And the border went to the right to those dwelling at the spring of Tappuah.

title: Joshua 17:8
content: 8 (The land of Tappuah was for Manasseh. And Tappuah at the border of Manasseh was for the sons of Ephraim.)

title: Joshua 17:9
content: 9 And the border went down to the wadi of Kanah, to the south of the wadi. These cities were for Ephraim in the midst of the cities of Manasseh. And the border of Manasseh was from north of the wadi, and its exits were at the sea.

title: Joshua 17:10
content: 10 To the south was for Ephraim, and to the north was for Manasseh, and the sea was its border. And it meets with Asher from the north and with Issachar from the sunrise.

title: Joshua 17:11
content: 11 And for Manasseh in Issachar and in Asher was Beth Shan and its daughters and Ibleam and its daughters and those who dwelled in Dor and its daughters and those who dwelled in En Dor and its daughters and those who dwelled in Taanach and its daughters and those who dwelled in Megiddo and its daughters, the three of Napheth.

title: Joshua 17:12
content: 12 And the sons of Manasseh were not able to take possession of these cities. And the Canaanite was determined to dwell in this land.

title: Joshua 17:13
content: 13 And it happened when the sons of Israel were strong, that they put the Canaanite to forced labor. And they did not completely dispossess them.

title: Joshua 17:14
content: 14 And the sons of Joseph spoke with Joshua, saying, “Why have you given to me one lot and one measured portion as an inheritance, and I am a numerous people, Yahweh has blessed me until up to now?”

title: Joshua 17:15
content: 15 And Joshua said to them, “If you are a numerous people, go up for yourself to the forest and clear for yourself there in the land of the Perizzite and the Rephaites. For the hill country of Ephraim is narrow for you.”

title: Joshua 17:16
content: 16 And the sons of Joseph said, “The hill country is not enough for us, and the chariot of iron is with every Canaanite who dwells in the land of the valley, for those who are in Beth Shan and its daughters and those who are in the valley of Jezreel.”

title: Joshua 17:17
content: 17 And Joshua spoke to the house of Joseph, to Ephraim and to Manasseh, saying, “You are a numerous people and great power is for you. There will not be one lot for you.

title: Joshua 17:18
content: 18 But the hill country will be for you, though it is a forest, and you will clear it and its exits will be for you. For you will dispossess the Canaanite, though the chariot of iron is for him, though he is strong.”

title: Joshua 18:1
content: 1 And all the congregation of the sons of Israel assembled at Shiloh and placed the Tent of Meeting there. And the land was subdued before their face.

title: Joshua 18:2
content: 2 And seven tribes remained among the sons of Israel that had not apportioned their inheritance.

title: Joshua 18:3
content: 3 And Joshua said to the sons of Israel, “Until when will you be showing yourselves slack to enter to possess the land that Yahweh the God of your fathers has given to you?

title: Joshua 18:4
content: 4 Provide for yourselves three men according to the tribe. And I will send them out and they will rise and walk about in the land and write it down according to the mouth of their inheritance and come to me.

title: Joshua 18:5
content: 5 And they will apportion it among themselves for seven portions. Judah will stand on its border from the south, and the house of Joseph will stand on their border from the north.

title: Joshua 18:6
content: 6 And you will write down the land in seven portions and bring them here to me. And I will throw a lot for you here before the face of Yahweh our God.

title: Joshua 18:7
content: 7 But there is no portion within you for the Levites because the priesthood of Yahweh is their inheritance. And Gad and Reuben and the half of the tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance from the other side of the Jordan toward sunrise, which Moses the servant of Yahweh gave to them.”

title: Joshua 18:8
content: 8 And the men rose and went. And Joshua commanded the ones who went to write down the land, saying, “Go and walk about in the land and write it down and return to me. And I will throw a lot for you here before the face of Yahweh in Shiloh.”

title: Joshua 18:9
content: 9 And the men went and passed over in the land and wrote it down on a book according to the cities in seven portions. And they came to Joshua, to the camp at Shiloh.

title: Joshua 18:10
content: 10 And Joshua threw a lot for them in Shiloh before the face of Yahweh. And there Joshua apportioned the land to the sons of Israel according to their portions.

title: Joshua 18:11
content: 11 And the lot of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin according to their clans went up. And the border of their lot went out between the sons of Judah and the sons of Joseph.

title: Joshua 18:12
content: 12 And the border for them was to the side to the north from the Jordan. And the border went up to the shoulder of Jericho from the north and went up in the hill country to the west. And its exits were at the wilderness of Beth Aven.

title: Joshua 18:13
content: 13 And the border passed over from there toward Luz, to the shoulder of Luz to the south (it is Bethel). And the border went down to Ataroth Addar, beside the mountain that is from south of Lower Beth Horon.

title: Joshua 18:14
content: 14 And the border turned and went around at the side of the west toward the south, from the mountain that is on the face of Beth Horon to the south. And its exits were at Kiriath Baal (it is Kiriath Jearim, a city of the sons of Judah). This was the side of the west.

title: Joshua 18:15
content: 15 And the side to the south was from the end of Kiriath Jearim. And the border went out to the west and went out to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah.

title: Joshua 18:16
content: 16 And the border then went down to the end of the mountain that is on the face of the valley of Ben Hinnom, which is in the valley of the Rephaites to the north. And it went down the valley of Hinnom to the shoulder of the Jebusite to the south and went down En Rogel.

title: Joshua 18:17
content: 17 Then it turned northward and went out to En Shemesh and went out to Geliloth, which is opposite the ascent of Adummim. Then it went down to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.

title: Joshua 18:18
content: 18 And it passed over to the shoulder of the front of the Arabah to the north and went down to the Arabah.

title: Joshua 18:19
content: 19 And the border passed over to the shoulder of Beth Hoglah to the north. And the exits of the border were at the tongue of the Sea of Salt to the north, at the end of the Jordan to the south. This was the border of the south.

title: Joshua 18:20
content: 20 And the Jordan borders it to the side toward the east. This was the inheritance of the sons of Benjamin, according to its borders all around, according to their clans.

title: Joshua 18:21
content: 21 And the cities of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin, according to their clans, were: Jericho and Beth Hoglah and the valley of Keziz

title: Joshua 18:22
content: 22 and Beth Arabah and Zemaraim and Bethel

title: Joshua 18:23
content: 23 and the Avvim, and the Parah, and Ophrah,

title: Joshua 18:24
content: 24 and Kephar Ammoni and the Ophni and Geba; 12 cities and their villages.

title: Joshua 18:25
content: 25 Gibeon and the Ramah and Beeroth

title: Joshua 18:26
content: 26 and the Mizpah and the Kephirah and the Mozah

title: Joshua 18:27
content: 27 and Rekem and Irpeel and Taralah

title: Joshua 18:28
content: 28 and Zelah, Haeleph, and the Jebusite (it is Jerusalem), Gibeah, Kiriath; 14 cities and their villages. This was the inheritance of the sons of Benjamin according to their clans.

title: Joshua 19:1
content: 1 And the second lot went out for Simeon, for the tribe of the sons of Simeon according to their clans. And their inheritance was in the midst of the inheritance of the sons of Judah.

title: Joshua 19:2
content: 2 And with their inheritance for them was Beersheba and Sheba and Moladah

title: Joshua 19:3
content: 3 and Hazar Shual and Balah and Ezem

title: Joshua 19:4
content: 4 and Eltolad and Bethul and Hormah

title: Joshua 19:5
content: 5 and Ziklag and Beth Markaboth and Hazar Susah

title: Joshua 19:6
content: 6 and Beth Lebaoth and Sharuhen; 13 cities and their villages.

title: Joshua 19:7
content: 7 Ain, Rimmon and Ether and Ashan; four cities and their villages

title: Joshua 19:8
content: 8 and all the villages that were around these cities as far as Baalath Beer (Ramah of the Negev). This was the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Simeon according to their clans.

title: Joshua 19:9
content: 9 Some of the measured portion of the sons of Judah was the inheritance of the sons of Simeon. For the portion of the sons of Judah was greater than them, so the sons of Simeon inherited in the midst of their inheritance.

title: Joshua 19:10
content: 10 And the third lot went up for the sons of Zebulun according to their clans. And the border of their inheritance was up to Sarid.

title: Joshua 19:11
content: 11 And their border went up toward the sea and Maralah and it met with Dabbesheth and met at the wadi that is on the face of Jokneam.

title: Joshua 19:12
content: 12 And it turned from Sarid toward the east, the rising of the sun, beside the border of Kisloth Tabor. And it went out to the Daberath and went up Japhia.

title: Joshua 19:13
content: 13 And from there it passed over toward the east, toward the sunrise, to Gath Hepher, to Eth Kazin. And it went out to Rimmon, turning toward Neah.

title: Joshua 19:14
content: 14 And the border went around it from the north of Hannathon (and its exits were the valley of Iphtah El),

title: Joshua 19:15
content: 15 and Kattath and Nahalal and Shimron and Idalah and Bethlehem; 12 cities and their villages.

title: Joshua 19:16
content: 16 This was the inheritance of the sons of Zebulun according to their clans—these cities and their villages.

title: Joshua 19:17
content: 17 The fourth lot went out for Issachar, for the sons of Issachar according to their clans.

title: Joshua 19:18
content: 18 And their border was toward Jezreel and the Chesulloth and Shunem

title: Joshua 19:19
content: 19 and Hapharaim and Shion and Anaharath

title: Joshua 19:20
content: 20 and the Rabbith and Kishion and Ebez

title: Joshua 19:21
content: 21 and Remeth and En Gannim and En Haddah and Beth Pazzez.

title: Joshua 19:22
content: 22 And the border met with Tabor, and Shahazumah and Beth Shemesh. And the exits of their border were at the Jordan; 16 cities and their villages.

title: Joshua 19:23
content: 23 This was the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Issachar according to their clans—their cities and their villages.

title: Joshua 19:24
content: 24 And the fifth lot went out for the tribe of the sons of Asher according to their clans.

title: Joshua 19:25
content: 25 And their border was Helkath and Hali and Beten and Akshaph

title: Joshua 19:26
content: 26 and Allammelek and Amad and Mishall. And it met with Carmel toward the sea and with Shihor Libnath.

title: Joshua 19:27
content: 27 And it turned back toward the rising of the sun to Beth Dagon and it met with Zebulun and with the valley of Iphtah El to the north, Beth Emek, and Neiel. And it went out to Kabul from the left

title: Joshua 19:28
content: 28 and Abdon and Rehob and Hammon and Kanah, as far as Great Sidon.

title: Joshua 19:29
content: 29 And the border turned back to the Ramah and up to the city of fortification of Tyre. And the border turned back to Hosah, and its exits were to the sea, from the measured portion of Akzib

title: Joshua 19:30
content: 30 and Ummah and Aphek and Rehob; 22 cities and their villages.

title: Joshua 19:31
content: 31 This was the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Asher according to their clans—these cities and their villages.

title: Joshua 19:32
content: 32 The sixth lot went out for the sons of Naphtali, for the sons of Napthali according to their clans.

title: Joshua 19:33
content: 33 And their border was from Heleph, from the oak in Zaanannim and Adami Nekeb and Jabneel, as far as Lakkum. And its exits were at the Jordan.

title: Joshua 19:34
content: 34 And the border turned back toward the west to Aznoth Tabor and went out from there to Hukkok. And it met with Zebulun from the south and met with Asher from the west and with Judah at the Jordan at the rising of the sun.

title: Joshua 19:35
content: 35 And the cities of fortification were the Ziddim, Zer and Hammath, Rakkath and Kinnereth

title: Joshua 19:36
content: 36 and Adamah and the Ramah and Hazor

title: Joshua 19:37
content: 37 and Kedesh and Edrei and En Hazor

title: Joshua 19:38
content: 38 and Yiron and Migdal El, Horem and Beth Anath and Beth Shemesh; 19 cities and their villages.

title: Joshua 19:39
content: 39 This was the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali according to their clans—the cities and their villages.

title: Joshua 19:40
content: 40 The seventh lot went out for the tribe of the sons of Dan according to their clans.

title: Joshua 19:41
content: 41 And the border of their inheritance was Zorah and Eshtaol and Ir Shemesh

title: Joshua 19:42
content: 42 and Shaalabbin and Aijalon and Ithlah

title: Joshua 19:43
content: 43 and Elon and Timnah and Ekron

title: Joshua 19:44
content: 44 and Eltekeh and Gibbethon and Baalath

title: Joshua 19:45
content: 45 and Jehud and Bene Berak and Gath Rimmon

title: Joshua 19:46
content: 46 and the waters of the Jarkon and the Rakkon with the territory in front of Joppa.

title: Joshua 19:47
content: 47 And the border of the sons of Dan went out from them. And the sons of Dan went up and fought against Leshem and captured it and struck it down by the mouth of the sword. And they possessed it and settled in it and called Leshem Dan, like the name of Dan their father.

title: Joshua 19:48
content: 48 This was the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Dan according to their clans—these cities and their villages.

title: Joshua 19:49
content: 49 And they finished inheriting the land according to its borders. And the sons of Israel gave an inheritance to Joshua the son of Nun in the midst of them.

title: Joshua 19:50
content: 50 In accordance with the mouth of Yahweh they gave to him the city that he asked for: Timnath Serah in the hill country of Ephraim. And he built the city and dwelled in it.

title: Joshua 19:51
content: 51 These are the inheritances that Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun and the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the sons of Israel apportioned as an inheritance by lot in Shiloh before the face of Yahweh at the opening of the tent of meeting. And they finished from apportioning the land.

title: Joshua 20:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Joshua, saying,

title: Joshua 20:2
content: 2 “Speak to the sons of Israel, saying, ‘Give for yourselves the cities of refuge, which I spoke about to you by the hand of Moses,

title: Joshua 20:3
content: 3 so that the one who kills, who strikes down a person by mistake without knowledge, may flee to there. And they will be for you as a refuge from the avenger of blood.

title: Joshua 20:4
content: 4 And he shall flee into one from these cities and stand at the opening of the gate of the city and speak his words in the ears of the elders of that city. And they shall gather him into the city to themselves and give to him a place and he shall dwell with them.

title: Joshua 20:5
content: 5 And if the avenger of blood pursues after him, then they shall not deliver the one who kills into his hand. For without knowledge he struck down his neighbor and he was not hating him from yesterday and three days ago.

title: Joshua 20:6
content: 6 And he shall dwell in that city until he stands before the face of the congregation for judgment, until the death of he who is the great priest in those days. Then the one who kills may return and enter into his city and into his house, into the city that he fled from.’”

title: Joshua 20:7
content: 7 And they set apart Kedesh in the Galilee in the hill country of Naphtali and Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim and Kiriath Arba (it is Hebron) in the hill country of Judah.

title: Joshua 20:8
content: 8 And from the other side of the Jordan, to Jericho toward the sunrise, they gave Bezer in the wilderness on the plateau from the tribe of Reuben and Ramoth in the Gilead from the tribe of Gad and Golan in the Bashan from the tribe of Manasseh.

title: Joshua 20:9
content: 9 These were the cities of appointment for all the sons of Israel and for the sojourner who sojourned in the midst of them, so that all who struck down a person by mistake could flee to there and not die by the hand of the avenger of blood until he stood before the face of the assembly.

title: Joshua 21:1
content: 1 And the heads of the fathers of the Levites came near to Eleazar the priest and to Joshua the son of Nun and to the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the sons of Israel.

title: Joshua 21:2
content: 2 And they spoke to them in Shiloh in the land of Canaan, saying, “Yahweh commanded by the hand of Moses to give to us cities to dwell in, with their pasturelands for our livestock.”

title: Joshua 21:3
content: 3 And the sons of Israel gave these cities and their pasturelands to the Levites from their inheritance, according to the mouth of Yahweh.

title: Joshua 21:4
content: 4 And the lot went out for the clans of the Kohathites. And there were 13 cities by the lot for the sons of Aaron the priest (from the Levites) from the tribe of Judah and from the tribe of the Simeonite and from the tribe of Benjamin.

title: Joshua 21:5
content: 5 And for the remaining sons of Kohath were ten cities by the lot from the clans of the tribes of Ephraim and from the tribe of Dan and from the half of the tribe of Manasseh.

title: Joshua 21:6
content: 6 And for the sons of Gershon were 13 cities by the lot from the clans of the tribe of Issachar and from the tribe of Asher and from the tribe of Naphtali and from the half of the tribe of Manasseh in the Bashan.

title: Joshua 21:7
content: 7 For the sons of Merari according to their clans were 12 cities from the tribe of Reuben and from the tribe of Gad and from the tribe of Zebulun.

title: Joshua 21:8
content: 8 And the sons of Israel gave to the Levites by the lot these cities and their pasturelands, just as Yahweh had commanded by the hand of Moses.

title: Joshua 21:9
content: 9 And they gave from the tribe of the sons of Judah and from the tribe of the sons of Simeon these cities, them which were called by name.

title: Joshua 21:10
content: 10 And they were for the sons of Aaron from the clans of the Kohathites from the sons of Levi because the first lot was for them.

title: Joshua 21:11
content: 11 And they gave to them Kiriath Arba, the father of the Anak (it is Hebron), in the hill country of Judah and its pasturelands around it.

title: Joshua 21:12
content: 12 And the field of the city and its villages they had given to Caleb the son of Jephunneh as his possession.

title: Joshua 21:13
content: 13 And to the sons of Aaron the priest they gave a city of refuge of the one who kills, Hebron and its pasturelands and Libnah and its pasturelands

title: Joshua 21:14
content: 14 and Jattir and its pasturelands and Eshtemoa and its pasturelands

title: Joshua 21:15
content: 15 and Holon and its pasturelands and Debir and its pasturelands

title: Joshua 21:16
content: 16 and Ain and its pasturelands and Juttah and its pasturelands and Beth Shemesh and its pasturelands; nine cities from with the two of these tribes.

title: Joshua 21:17
content: 17 And from the tribe of Benjamin were Gibeon and its pasturelands, Geba and its pasturelands,

title: Joshua 21:18
content: 18 Anathoth and its pasturelands, and Almon and its pasturelands; four cities.

title: Joshua 21:19
content: 19 All the cities of the sons of Aaron, the priests, were 13 cities and their pasturelands.

title: Joshua 21:20
content: 20 And for the clans of the sons of Kohath, the Levites, the remaining ones from the sons of Kohath, were the cities of their lot from the tribe of Ephraim.

title: Joshua 21:21
content: 21 And they gave to them a city of refuge of the one who kills, Shechem and its pasturelands in the hill country of Ephraim and Gezer and its pasturelands

title: Joshua 21:22
content: 22 and Kibzaim and its pasturelands and Beth Horon and its pasturelands; four cities.

title: Joshua 21:23
content: 23 And from the tribe of Dan were Eltekeh and its pasturelands, Gibbethon and its pasturelands,

title: Joshua 21:24
content: 24 Aijalon and its pasturelands, Gath Rimmon and its pasturelands; four cities.

title: Joshua 21:25
content: 25 And from the half of the tribe of Manasseh were Taanach and its pasturelands and Gath Rimmon and its pasturelands; two cities.

title: Joshua 21:26
content: 26 All the ten cities and their pasturelands were for the remaining clans of the sons of Kohath.

title: Joshua 21:27
content: 27 And for the sons of Gershon from the clans of the Levites, from the half of the tribe of Manasseh was a city of refuge of the one who kills, Golan in the Bashan and its pasturelands, and Be Eshterah and its pasturelands; two cities.

title: Joshua 21:28
content: 28 And from the tribe of Issachar were Kishion and its pasturelands, Daberath and its pasturelands,

title: Joshua 21:29
content: 29 Jarmuth and its pasturelands, En Gannim and its pasturelands; four cities.

title: Joshua 21:30
content: 30 And from the tribe of Asher were Mishal and its pasturelands, Abdon and its pasturelands,

title: Joshua 21:31
content: 31 Helkath and its pasturelands, and Rehob and its pasturelands; four cities.

title: Joshua 21:32
content: 32 And from the tribe of Naphtali were a city of refuge of the one who killed, Kedesh in the Galilee and its pasturelands and Hammoth Dor and its pasturelands and Kartan and its pasturelands; three cities.

title: Joshua 21:33
content: 33 All the cities of the Gershonites according to their clans were 13 cities and their pasturelands.

title: Joshua 21:34
content: 34 And for the clans of the sons of Merari, the remaining Levites, from with the tribe of Zebulun were Jokneam and its pasturelands, Kartah and its pasturelands,

title: Joshua 21:35
content: 35 Dimnah and its pasturelands, Nahalal and its pasturelands; four cities.

title: Joshua 21:36
content: 36 And from the tribe of Reuben were Bezer and its pasturelands and Jahaz and its pasturelands,

title: Joshua 21:37
content: 37 Kedemoth and its pasturelands and Mephaath and its pasturelands; four cities.

title: Joshua 21:38
content: 38 And from the tribe of Gad were a city of refuge of the one who killed, Ramoth in the Gilead and its pasturelands and Mahanaim and its pasturelands,

title: Joshua 21:39
content: 39 Heshbon and its pasturelands, Jazer and its pasturelands; all of the cities were four.

title: Joshua 21:40
content: 40 All the cities for the sons of Merari according to their clans, the remaining ones from the clans of the Levites, were 12 cities by their lot.

title: Joshua 21:41
content: 41 All the cities of the Levites in the midst of the possession of the sons of Israel were 48 cities and their pasturelands.

title: Joshua 21:42
content: 42 These cities were city by city, and its pasturelands were around it. It was so for all these cities.

title: Joshua 21:43
content: 43 And Yahweh gave to Israel all the land that he had sworn to give to their fathers. And they possessed it and dwelled in it.

title: Joshua 21:44
content: 44 And Yahweh gave rest to them from all around, according to all that he had sworn to their fathers. And a man did not stand against their face from all their enemies. Yahweh gave all their enemies into their hand.

title: Joshua 21:45
content: 45 A word did not fall from every good word that Yahweh had spoken to the house of Israel The whole came to be.

title: Joshua 22:1
content: 1 Then Joshua called to the Reubenite and to the Gadite and to the half of the tribe of Manasseh.

title: Joshua 22:2
content: 2 And he said to them, “You yourselves have kept all that Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded you. And you have listened to my voice according to all that I have commanded you.

title: Joshua 22:3
content: 3 You have not forsaken your brothers this many days, until this day. And you have kept the keeping of the commandments of Yahweh your God.

title: Joshua 22:4
content: 4 And now Yahweh your God has given rest to your brothers, just as he spoke to them. And now, turn and go for yourselves to your tents, to the land of your possession, which Moses the servant of Yahweh gave to you on the other side of the Jordan.

title: Joshua 22:5
content: 5 Only watch exceedingly to do the commandment and the law that Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded you, to love Yahweh your God and to walk in all his ways and to keep his commandments and to cling to him, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your self.”

title: Joshua 22:6
content: 6 And Joshua blessed them. And he sent them away and they went to their tents.

title: Joshua 22:7
content: 7 Now to the half of the tribe of Manasseh, Moses had given in the Bashan, and to the half of him, Joshua gave with their brothers on the other side of the Jordan to the sea. And when Joshua had also sent them away to their tents, then he blessed them.

title: Joshua 22:8
content: 8 And he spoke to them, saying, “Return to your tents with many riches and with very much livestock, with silver and with gold and with bronze and with iron and with very many garments. Apportion the spoil of your enemies with your brothers.”

title: Joshua 22:9
content: 9 And the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and the half of the tribe of Manasseh turned back and went from with the sons of Israel, from Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan, to go to the land of the Gilead, to the land of their possession, it which they had seized for themselves in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh by the hand of Moses.

title: Joshua 22:10
content: 10 And they entered into the territories of the Jordan that are in the land of Canaan. And the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and the half of the tribe of Manasseh built there an altar beside the Jordan—an altar large of appearance.

title: Joshua 22:11
content: 11 And the sons of Israel heard, saying, “Behold, the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and the half of the tribe of Manasseh have built the altar at the front of the land of Canaan, at the territories of the Jordan, at the side of the sons of Israel.”

title: Joshua 22:12
content: 12 And the sons of Israel heard and all the congregation of the sons of Israel assembled at Shiloh to go up for war against them.

title: Joshua 22:13
content: 13 And the sons of Israel sent Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, to the sons of Reuben and to the sons of Gad and to the half of the tribe of Manasseh, into the land of the Gilead.

title: Joshua 22:14
content: 14 And ten leaders were with him, one leader by one leader of the house of the father of all the tribes of Israel. And they were each a man of the head of the house of their fathers of the thousands of Israel.

title: Joshua 22:15
content: 15 And they came to the sons of Reuben and to the sons of Gad and to the half of the tribe of Manasseh, into the land of the Gilead. And they spoke with them, saying,

title: Joshua 22:16
content: 16 “Thus says all the congregation of Yahweh, ‘What is this unfaithfulness that you have done unfaithfully against the God of Israel, to turn today from after Yahweh when you built for yourselves an altar today for your rebelling against Yahweh?

title: Joshua 22:17
content: 17 Was the iniquity of Peor little for us, it from which we have not purified ourselves until this day? And there was a plague among the congregation of Yahweh.

title: Joshua 22:18
content: 18 But as for you, you are turning from after Yahweh today! And it will happen that you yourselves will rebel against Yahweh today and tomorrow he will be furious toward all the congregation of Israel.

title: Joshua 22:19
content: 19 However, if the land of your possession is defiled, cross over for yourselves into the land of the possession of Yahweh, there where the dwelling of Yahweh dwells, and take possession in the midst of us. But do not rebel against Yahweh and do not rebel against us by your building an altar for yourselves apart from the altar of Yahweh our God.

title: Joshua 22:20
content: 20 Did not Achan the son of Zerah act unfaithfully in unfaithfulness with the banned thing and wrath was on all the congregation of Israel? And he did not perish as one man in his iniquity.’”

title: Joshua 22:21
content: 21 And the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and the half of the tribe of Manasseh answered and spoke with the heads of the thousands of Israel:

title: Joshua 22:22
content: 22 “Yahweh is God of gods! Yahweh is God of gods! He knows, and as for Israel, let it know! If it was in rebellion or if in unfaithfulness against Yahweh, do not save us this day!

title: Joshua 22:23
content: 23 If it was to build an altar for ourselves to turn from after Yahweh, or if to offer on it burnt up offerings or grain offerings or if to make on it the sacrifices of peace offerings, Yahweh himself will seek out.

title: Joshua 22:24
content: 24 But no! Because of anxiety from a matter we did this, saying, ‘Tomorrow your sons might say to our sons, saying, “What is for you and for Yahweh, the God of Israel?

title: Joshua 22:25
content: 25 And Yahweh has given a border between us and between you sons of Reuben and sons of Gad, the Jordan. There is no portion for you in Yahweh.”’ And your sons might make our sons cease so that they are not fearing Yahweh.

title: Joshua 22:26
content: 26 And we said, ‘Let us now prepare for ourselves to build the altar, not for a burnt up offering and not for a sacrifice.

title: Joshua 22:27
content: 27 But it will be a witness between us and between you and between our generations after us, to serve the service of Yahweh before his face, with our burnt up offerings and with our sacrifices and with our peace offerings. And your sons will not say to our sons tomorrow, “There is no portion for you in Yahweh.”’

title: Joshua 22:28
content: 28 And we said, ‘And it will happen if they speak to us or to our generations of tomorrow, that we will say, “See the copy of the altar of Yahweh, which our fathers made, not for a burnt up offering and not for a sacrifice, but it is a witness between us and between you.”

title: Joshua 22:29
content: 29 May it be far from us for us to rebel against Yahweh, and turn today from after Yahweh to build an altar for a burnt up offering, for a grain offering, or for a sacrifice, apart from the altar of Yahweh our God that is before the face of his dwelling!’”

title: Joshua 22:30
content: 30 And Phinehas the priest and the leaders of the congregation and the heads of the thousands of Israel who were with him heard the words that the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and the sons of Manasseh spoke. And it was good in their eyes.

title: Joshua 22:31
content: 31 And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest said to the sons of Reuben and to the sons of Gad and to the sons of Manasseh, “Today we know that Yahweh is in the midst of us, that you have not acted unfaithfully in this unfaithfulness against Yahweh. Therefore you have rescued the sons of Israel from the hand of Yahweh.”

title: Joshua 22:32
content: 32 And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest and the leaders returned from with the sons of Reuben and from with the sons of Gad, from the land of the Gilead, to the land of Canaan, to the sons of Israel. And they brought them back a word.

title: Joshua 22:33
content: 33 And the word was good in the eyes of the sons of Israel. And the sons of Israel blessed God and did not speak of going up against them for war to destroy the land in which the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad were dwelling.

title: Joshua 22:34
content: 34 And the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad called the altar “Truly it is a witness between us that Yahweh is God.”

title: Joshua 23:1
content: 1 And it happened from many days afterward, when Yahweh had given rest to Israel from all their enemies from all around, that Joshua was old, he came into the days.

title: Joshua 23:2
content: 2 And Joshua called for all Israel, for its elders and for its heads and for its judges and for its officers. And he said to them, “I am old, I have come into the days.

title: Joshua 23:3
content: 3 But as for you, you have seen all that Yahweh your God has done to all these nations from your face. For Yahweh your God, he is the one who fights for you.

title: Joshua 23:4
content: 4 See, I have caused to fall for you these remaining nations as an inheritance for your tribes, from the Jordan and all the nations that I cut off and the great sea, from the going of the sun.

title: Joshua 23:5
content: 5 And Yahweh your God, he will push them from your face and will dispossess them from before your face. And you will possess their land, just as Yahweh your God spoke to you.

title: Joshua 23:6
content: 6 And you shall be very strong to keep and to do all that is written in the book of the law of Moses, to not turn aside from it right or left,

title: Joshua 23:7
content: 7 to not go among these nations, these remaining ones with you. And by the name of their gods you shall not mention and not swear. And you shall not serve them and not bow down to them.

title: Joshua 23:8
content: 8 But rather to Yahweh your God you shall cling, just as you have done until this day.

title: Joshua 23:9
content: 9 And Yahweh has dispossessed great and numerous nations from your face. And as for you, a man has not stood against your face until this day.

title: Joshua 23:10
content: 10 One man from you pursues a thousand. For Yahweh is your God. He is the one who fights for you, just as he has spoken to you.

title: Joshua 23:11
content: 11 And you shall keep yourselves exceedingly for your selves, to love Yahweh your God.

title: Joshua 23:12
content: 12 For if you ever turn back and cling to the remainder of these nations, these remaining ones with you, and you intermarry with them and you go among them and they among you,

title: Joshua 23:13
content: 13 you shall know assuredly that Yahweh your God will not continue to dispossess these nations from before your face. And they will be to you as a trap and as a snare and as a whip on your sides and as thorns in your eyes, until you perish from on this good ground that Yahweh your God has given to you.

title: Joshua 23:14
content: 14 And behold, today I am about to go the way of all the earth. And you know with all your heart and with all your soul that not one word has fallen from all the good words that Yahweh your God spoke concerning you. The whole has come to you, not one word from it has fallen.

title: Joshua 23:15
content: 15 And it will happen that just as all the good word that Yahweh your God spoke to you has come upon you, so Yahweh will bring upon you all the evil word until he has destroyed you from this good ground that Yahweh your God has given to you.

title: Joshua 23:16
content: 16 When you pass over the covenant of Yahweh your God that he commanded you and go and serve other gods and bow down to them, then the nose of Yahweh will burn against you. And you will quickly perish from the good land that he has given to you.”

title: Joshua 24:1
content: 1 And Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem. And he called for the elders of Israel, and for its heads, and for its judges, and for its officers. And they presented themselves before the face of God.

title: Joshua 24:2
content: 2 And Joshua said to all the people, “Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, ‘Your fathers dwelled beyond the river from long ago—Terah the father of Abraham and the father of Nahor. And they served other gods.

title: Joshua 24:3
content: 3 And I took your father Abraham from beyond the river and brought him into all the land of Canaan. And I multiplied his seed and gave to him Isaac.

title: Joshua 24:4
content: 4 And I gave Jacob and Esau to Isaac. And I gave to Esau the hill country of Seir to possess it. And Jacob and his sons went down to Egypt.

title: Joshua 24:5
content: 5 And I sent Moses and Aaron, and I struck Egypt just as I did within it. And afterward I brought you out.

title: Joshua 24:6
content: 6 And I brought your fathers out from Egypt, and you came to the sea. And Egypt chased after your fathers with chariot and horsemen to the sea of reeds.

title: Joshua 24:7
content: 7 And they cried out to Yahweh, and he put darkness between you and the Egyptians. And he brought the sea over him and covered him. And Your eyes saw what I did against Egypt. And you dwelled in the wilderness many days.

title: Joshua 24:8
content: 8 And I brought you to the land of the Amorite, the ones who dwelled on the other side of the Jordan, and they fought with you. And I gave them into your hand, and you possessed their land, and I destroyed them from before your face.

title: Joshua 24:9
content: 9 And Balak the son of Zippor, the king of Moab, got up and fought against Israel. And he sent and called for Balaam the son of Beor to curse you.

title: Joshua 24:10
content: 10 And I was not willing to listen to Balaam. And he blessed you repeatedly, and I rescued you from his hand.

title: Joshua 24:11
content: 11 And you crossed over the Jordan and came to Jericho. And the men of Jericho, the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Girgashite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite, fought against you. And I gave them into your hand.

title: Joshua 24:12
content: 12 And I sent the hornet before your face and it drove them out from before your face—two kings of the Amorite. It was not by your sword and not by your bow.

title: Joshua 24:13
content: 13 And I gave to you a land for which you did not labor, and cities that you did not build and you dwell in them. You are eating vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant.’

title: Joshua 24:14
content: 14 And now, you shall fear Yahweh and serve him with completeness and with faithfulness. And you shall remove the gods that your fathers served beyond the river and in Egypt, and serve Yahweh.

title: Joshua 24:15
content: 15 But if it is evil in your eyes to serve Yahweh, choose for yourselves today whom you will serve, whether the gods which your fathers served that were beyond the river, or the gods of the Amorite in whose land you are dwelling. But as for me and my house, we will serve Yahweh.”

title: Joshua 24:16
content: 16 And the people answered and said, “Far be it for us from leaving Yahweh to serve other gods!

title: Joshua 24:17
content: 17 For Yahweh is our God, he is the one who brought us and our fathers up from the land of Egypt, from the house of slavery, and who did these great signs before our eyes. And he kept us in all the way in which we went, and among all the peoples among whom we passed.

title: Joshua 24:18
content: 18 And Yahweh drove out from our face all the peoples, even the Amorite who dwelled in the land. We too, we will serve Yahweh because he is our God.”

title: Joshua 24:19
content: 19 And Joshua said to the people, “You will not be able to serve Yahweh because he is a holy God. He is a jealous God, he will not lift your transgressions and your sins.

title: Joshua 24:20
content: 20 If you forsake Yahweh and serve the gods of the foreigner, then he will turn and do harm to you and finish you, after he has done good to you.”

title: Joshua 24:21
content: 21 And the people said to Joshua, “No, but we will serve Yahweh.”

title: Joshua 24:22
content: 22 And Joshua said to the people, “You are witnesses against yourselves that you yourselves have chosen for yourselves Yahweh, to serve him.” And they said, “Witnesses.”

title: Joshua 24:23
content: 23 “And now, remove the gods of the foreigner that are among you. And bend your heart to Yahweh the God of Israel.”

title: Joshua 24:24
content: 24 And the people said to Joshua, “We will serve Yahweh our God, and we will listen to his voice.”

title: Joshua 24:25
content: 25 And Joshua cut a covenant for the people on that day. And he set for them a statute and a judgment in Shechem.

title: Joshua 24:26
content: 26 And Joshua wrote these words in the book of the law of God. And he took a large stone and set it up there beneath the oak tree that was at the Holy Place of Yahweh.

title: Joshua 24:27
content: 27 And Joshua said to all the people, “Behold, this stone will be for a witness against us, because it has heard all the words of Yahweh which he spoke to us. And it will be for a witness against you, lest you act deceptively against your God.”

title: Joshua 24:28
content: 28 And Joshua sent the people away, a man to his inheritance.

title: Joshua 24:29
content: 29 And it happened after these things that Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Yahweh, died, a son of 110 years.

title: Joshua 24:30
content: 30 And they buried him in the border of his inheritance, in Timnath Serah, which is in the hill country of Ephraim, from the north of Mount Gaash.

title: Joshua 24:31
content: 31 And Israel served Yahweh all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders who lengthened days after Joshua, and who knew every deed of Yahweh that he had done for Israel.

title: Joshua 24:32
content: 32 And the bones of Joseph, which the sons of Israel brought up from Egypt, they buried in Shechem, in the portion of the field that Jacob had bought from with the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem, with a hundred pieces of money. And it became an inheritance for the sons of Joseph.

title: Joshua 24:33
content: 33 And Eleazar the son of Aaron died. And they buried him in Gibeah of Phinehas his son, which had been given to him in the hill country of Ephraim.
